data: Nurse to Initiate Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase. These orders continue on the Inpatient Unit
Discontinue PLASURG Craniofacial - Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
Keep lips moist with polysporin or petroleum jelly. Rinse and spit with hospital mouthwash (0.12% chlorhexidine gluconate) QID after meals and PRN
Oral suction available at bedside for patient to use -  specific to craniofacial patients
Clean craniofacial abrasions / lacerations / suture lines TID with half-strength hydrogen peroxide
1 application, topical, TID, order duration: 7 day, drug form: oint
2 drop, eye-both, q4h, drug form: eye drop
2 drop, eye-left, q4h, drug form: eye drop
2 drop, eye-right, q4h, drug form: eye drop

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: bag
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 3 day, drug form: bag
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 1 day, drug form: bag
500 mg, PO, q6h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab
500 mg, PO, q6h, order duration: 3 day, drug form: tab
500 mg, PO, q6h, order duration: 1 day, drug form: tab
If ceFAZolin allergic or contraindicated, select vancomycin and/or metroNIDAZOLE
For documented MRSA colonization, consider using vancomycin
Check renal function and order vancomycin levels
15 mg/kg, IV, q12h, order duration: 5 day
500 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: bag
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
q1h for 2 hour, then q4h for 24 hour, then q6h for 24 hour, post-op day 1, then q8h for 24 hour, post-op day 2, then q12h for 24 hour, post-op day 3, then qdaily until discharge
on arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hour, then q12h for 24 hour, then qdaily until discharge
